One study considered a combined educational and exercise-based intervention (119), and 
one used a baby massage intervention (120). These studies are heterogeneous in design. 
All of the included studies reported the incidence of maternal depression at different time-
points. Depression was measured using a variety of tools, with some studies using more 
than one. The majority of reports (n=22) used the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Score
